linklogin-desc: Allows to automatically authenticate users with a hash in a link
linklogin-user-error-special: Username must not contain special characters (except spaces)!
linklogin-populated: user_email_token fields for $1 user{{plural:$1| has|s have}} been populated.
linklogin-reset-success: The user_email_token for user “$1” has been reset.
linklogin-reset-fail: The user_email_token for user “$1” could not be reset.
linklogin-reset-fail-no-user: The user with the id $1 does not exist. The user_email_token could not be reset.
linklogin-list-heading: List of all users with hashes
linklogin-groupcount: $1 {{plural:$1|user is|users are}} in the groups defined by $LinkLoginGroups ($2)
linklogin-conditioncount: $1 of them meet{{plural:$1|s}} all the conditions and ha{{plural:$1|s|ve}} a hash defined:
linklogin-subjecttemplate-help: What template should be used to create the message subject?
linklogin-template-help: What template should be used to create the message body?
linklogin-loginpage-help: Where should the user land after logging in with the link?
linklogin-signature-help: HTML signature to be used in the message
linklogin-email-help: What user option should be used for recipients' mail addresses? If more than one option is given the first available address will be used. The following options can be used: $1
linklogin-only: Users have to be in this list
linklogin-only-help: Enter comma-seperated list, wikitext will be expanded
linklogin-except-help: Enter comma-seperated list, wikitext will be expanded
linklogin-noedit: This page is not linked to your account.
action-populateloginlinks: populate the user table with login links
